result.execSummary:
The defendant Ignacio Mendez Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

The defendant may petition for early termination of probation after 9 months at the recommendation of the agent.
No Violent contact with the victim or any family member. Attend Domestic Violence Counseling. Provide DNA specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Comply with any other condition deemed appropriate by agent. Case 14CM2300 was dismissed and read in.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Ignacio Mendez Ortiz in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Victim addresses the Court.  The Defendant was given the following:
Count #1:

WITHHELD SENTENCE;

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR(S); (the Defendant may petition for early termination of probation after 9 months at the recommendaiton of the agent).

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*No violent contact with:  victim or any family member. 
*Domestic Violence Counseling. 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Any other condition deemed appropriate by agent. 

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (apply cash bail);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (apply cash bail);

Count #2:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS JAIL.

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR( the Defendant may petition for early termination of probation after 9 months at the recommendaiton of the agent).

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
SAME AS COUNT #1

COURT COSTS:  $343.00 (apply cash bail);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (apply cash bail and balance to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 30 DAYS, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court.   Defendant Ignacio Mendez Ortiz in court.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      Attorney Martinez is requesting an adjournment of the hearing today as he is ill.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing hearing at 01-13-2016 10:00 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ignacio Mendez Ortiz in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1.  The Defendant enters a plea of guilty to count #2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Bail remains as set.  The Court sets the matter for a sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
